articles.title: DPRK Proposes to Start of Peace Talks
articles.content:
DPRK Proposes to Start of Peace Talks
 Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued Monday the following statement:
					 A year has gone by while the process for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula is standing at the crossroads due to serious challenges to it.
					
					 The denuclearization of the Peninsula is the goal of the policy consistently pursued by the Government of the Republic with a view to contributing to peace and security in Northeast Asia and the denuclearization of the world.
					
					 It was thanks to the sincere and exhaustive efforts of the Government of the Republic that dialogues had taken place for the denuclearization of the Peninsula since the 1990s and, in this course, such important bilateral and multilateral agreements as the "DPRK-US Agreed Framework" and the September 19 Joint Statement were adopted.
					
					 The implementation of all the agreements, however, stopped half way or was overturned. Since then the nuclear threat on the Korean Peninsula has not been decreased, but on the contrary it has further increased and, consequently, even nuclear deterrent came into being.
					
					 The course of the six-party talks which witnessed repeated frustrations and failures proves that the issue can never be settled without confidence among the parties concerned. Still today the talks remain blocked by the barrier of distrust called sanctions against the DPRK.
					
					 It is our conclusion that it is necessary to pay primary attention to building confidence between the DPRK and the United States, the parties chiefly responsible for the nuclear issue, in order to bring back the process for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula on track.
					
					 If confidence is to be built between the DPRK and the US, it is essential to conclude a peace treaty for terminating the state of war, a root cause of the hostile relations, to begin with.
					
					 When the parties are in the state of war where they level guns at each other, distrust in the other party can never be wiped out and the talks themselves can never make smooth progress, much less realizing the denuclearization. Without settling such essential and fundamental issue as war and peace no agreement can escape from frustration and failure as now.
					
					 The peace treaty by nature should have been already concluded in the light of its intrinsic necessity, regardless of the nuclear issue. Had durable peace regime been established on the Korean Peninsula long ago, the nuclear issue would have not surfaced.
					
					 Now that the issue of concluding the peace treaty is mentioned in the September 19 Joint Statement, too, it is good to move up the order of action as required by practice in the light of the lesson drawn from the failure of the six-party talks.
					
					 The conclusion of the peace treaty will help terminate the hostile relations between the DPRK and the US and positively promote the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula at a rapid tempo.
					
					 Upon authorization, the DPRK Foreign Ministry courteously proposes to the parties to the Armistice Agreement an early start of the talks for replacing the AA by the peace treaty this year which marks the lapse of 60 years since the outbreak of the Korean War.
					
					 The above-said talks may be held either at a separate forum as laid down in the September 19 Joint Statement or in the framework of the six-party talks for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula like the DPRK-US talks now under way in view of their nature and significance.
					
					 The removal of the barrier of such discrimination and distrust as sanctions may soon lead to the opening of the six-party talks.
					
					If the parties to the AA sincerely hope for peace and security and the denuclearization of the Peninsula, they should no longer prioritize their interests but make a bold decision to deal with the fundamental issue without delay.

articles.title: Ten Best Players for 2009 Selected
articles.content:
Ten Best Players for 2009 Selected
 Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The list of 10 best players and coaches for Juche 98 (2009) was made public in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The best players are as follows:
					
					 1.Yang Kyong Il (male wrestler)
					
					 2. Kim Chol Su (male judoist) 
					
					 3. Han Kum Ok (female wrestler)
					
					 4. So Sim Hyang (female wrestler)
					
					 5. Rim Yun Hui (female judoist)
					
					 6. Hong Un Jong (female gymnast)
					
					 7. O Jong Ae (female weightlifter)
					
					 8. Ri Myong Guk (male footballer)
					
					 9. Jo Tong Hyok (male wrestler)
					
					 10. Pak Hyon Suk (female weightlifter)
					
					  The selected coaches are Ri Chang Jong (wrestling), Ri Kwang (Judo), Kang Chan Yong (wrestling), Pak Jong Jin (wrestling), Ri Song Chol (judo), Kim Chun Phil (gymnastics), So Un Hak (weightlifting), Kim Jong Hun (football), Pak Hye Jong (weightlifting) and Pak Ki Song (weightlifting).

articles.title: Year of Offensive for Improving People's Living
articles.content:
Year of Offensive for Improving People's Living
 Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- Juche 99 (2010) is a year of a general offensive for improving the people's living standard in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					In the joint New Year editorial of Rodong Sinmun, Josoninmingun and Chongnyonjonwi, the DPRK's leading newspapers, the Workers' Party of Korea calls for launching a sweeping campaign to bring about a drastic turn in improving the people's living standard in the flames of the great revolutionary upsurge. 
					
					 The call has made the whole country permeated with the spirit of a new offensive.
					
					This year the Korean people will celebrate the 65th anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 The glorious Party strives to realise the ideals of the people.
					
					Thanks to the wise leadership of the great party, which regards the people as supreme and spares nothing for them, the people-centered socialism of Korean style has been firmly defended and a new era of national prosperity filled with the people's happiness has come.
					
					 Enormous are potentials of the light-industry production provided by the Korean people despite trials under the leadership of the Party.
					
					The might of the country's economy including heavy industry has been further strengthened in the flames of the great upsurge, setting up a springboard for socialist Korea of Juche, already a politico-ideological and military power, to reach the status of a strong economy in a dignified manner.
					
					 The workers of the updated factories and enterprises in the light-industry sector have massproduced quality consumer goods through great innovations and a fresh leap forward.
					
					 The agricultural working people have also turned out in the efforts for sharply increasing grain production.
					
					There is no unconquerable fortress for the Korean people whose inexhaustible mental strength have been brought into full play under the WPK's veteran leadership and by dint of the might of the Party and the people in perfect harmony.
					
					The Korean people are now in high spirits to implement the call of the WPK.

articles.title: Military Forces' Moves to Control Media under Fire
articles.content:
Military Forces' Moves to Control Media under Fire
 Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Committee for Settling the Past History for Truth and Reconciliation called a news conference in Seoul on January 7 to disclose the truth about the "media restructuring" conducted by Chun Doo Hwan-led military dictatorship forces in the past with an aim to seize power.
					 According to it, in 1980 the military dictatorship forces set the "Defense Security Command" in motion to make a detailed survey of individual sentiments of all the mediapersons, their relations with politicians and so on under the pretext of "ensuring public utility of broadcasting" and on its basis chose the objects of "media restructuring".
					
					 The military forces let the "Office of National Tax Administration" and the "Board of Audit and Inspection" put under surveillance and keep watch on those mediapersons who turned away from the demand of the "Defense Security Command" and sent notice to media organs that they would face management crisis, thus threatening them.
					
					 The dictators even declared the "martial law" and forced managers of media institutions to tender their resignations and went the lengths of threatening them to submit written requests for resignation by proxy.
					
					 As a result, many press organs including papers and news agencies were forced to "reform their structure" and the registration of periodical publications was cancelled by force for no reason.
					
					 In the meantime, the military dictators confiscated even properties of press organs and individual mediapersons under the pretext of "redemption" and "donation". They released misinformation that all those acts were in accord with "free will" in a bid to cover up the truth.
					
					 The military forces massively expelled progressive mediapersons in order to build media structure that accepts their dictatorship system.
					
					 They forced some of dismissed pressmen to enter the "Samchong Reeducation Corps" and imposed upon them all sorts of sufferings and restricted their employment in the subsequent period, too.
					
					 The above-said committee, disclosing these facts, demanded the present authorities recognize violation of the freedom of speech committed by the past military dictatorial regime and make an apology to the victims and take measures to ensure their reinstatement and compensation for them.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Supported
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Supported 
 Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- A joint statement was issued by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and a statement by the Czech, Moravian and Silesian Trade Unions' Association of the Czech Republic on Jan. 5 in support of the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK.
					 The British organizations in the joint statement noted that the joint editorial proudly reviewed the successes gained by the Korean people in building a great prosperous and powerful nation last year.
					
					 The credit for these achievements goes to the Songun leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the statement stressed.
					
					 The joint editorial called for improving the people's standard of living this year, it said, adding that it is of significance that the DPRK government decided to bring about a radical turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living when the imperialist countries have been troubled with unemployment and deteriorated people's life.
					
					 The statement called upon the followers of the Juche idea, the Songun idea, to support the DPRK's joint New Year editorial, expressing firm conviction that the Korean people would carry through the tasks set forth in the joint editorial under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il this year.
					
					 The Czech organization in the statement introduced in detail the tasks for improving the people's standard of living and bringing earlier the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea set forth in the joint editorial. And it wished the Korean people greater success in the drive to improve the people's standard of living this year.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, January 11 (KCNA) -- One day in the latter half of February Juche 60 (1971), President Kim Il Sung visited the Yahak Co-op Farm in Kanggye City, Jagang Province.
					During a conversation with the farm officials he asked them about how many hectares of vegetable fields were under the water-jetting system.
					
					 One of them answered the acreage under the system was 34 hectares in all.
					
					 When the President asked again how many water pumps were installed, the official answered only two.
					
					 Saying that two pumps would not be enough to water all the 34 hectares, he requested the official to give the exact number of fully irrigated hectares.
					
					 Blushing at his words the official said water was reaching well to 16 hectares, but insufficiently to 18.
					
					 The President wrote down what he said on his handbook and asked how many water pumps were needed more to water all the piped fields.
					
					 Listening to the official's answer that they needed two more, he emphasized that a proper number of water pumps should be set up to see the water-jetting system paying off.
					
					 In fact some officials had thought that the pipe laying was all in the completion of the sprinkling irrigation system, without taking the capacity of water pump into account.
					
					 But the President noticed their miscalculation quickly and was kind enough to correct it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige sobre terreno fabrica de aparatos electronicos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige sobre terreno fabrica de aparatos electronicos
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica de Aparatos Electronicos de Kangdong acondicionada magnificamente conforme a la demanda de la epoca del Songun.
					 Tras escuchar explicaciones ante el plano de la fabrica, el Dirigente se entero detalladamente del estado de reconstruccion tecnica y produccion recorriendo por varias horas el exterior y el interior de esa reconstruida y modernizada planta.
					
					 Muy satisfecho de que la clase obrera de ella lograra un desarrollo vertiginoso en la produccion de aparatos electronicos mediante la excelente modernizacion y fundamentacion cientifica de los procesos de produccion como la introduccion de la tecnologia CNC, dijo que esto es una muestra contundente de la justeza y la vitalidad de la politica de nuestro partido de tomar la ciencia y la tecnica como la linea vital de la construccion de una potencia economica.
					
					 Si se realizan la modernizacion y la cientifizacion basadas en las ciencias y tecnicas de punta consolidando constantemente el caracter autoctono de la economia nacional como en esta fabrica, se pueden poner en pleno juego la superioridad y la vitalidad de nuestra economia nacional independiente, destaco y evaluo mucho el modo revolucionario y la actitud emprendedora de trabajo de los funcionarios y obreros de la planta.
					
					 Cuando vio varios accesorios de construccion y articulos de primera necesidad producidos en la fabrica empleando eficazmente las materias residuales, elogio el espiritu de servir al pueblo de aquellos diciendo que esos productos son de gran calidad.
					
					 Acto seguido, recorrio los establecimientos culturales y de servicio publico como la casa de cultura y el comedor construidos originalmente. Senalando que esta fabrica hace recordar un centro de reposo, evaluo altamente los esfuerzos de los funcionarios de ella que facilitaron magnificas condiciones de vida a los obreros.
					
					 Dijo que esta fabrica sirve de ejemplo en todos los aspectos tanto en las labores para modernizar y cientifizar los procesos de produccion como en el establecimiento de la cultura de trabajo y vida y en el servicio de abastecimiento a los empleados.
					
					Subrayo que todas las unidades deben seguir activamente ese magnifico ejemplo.
					
					 Apunto que los orgullosos exitos alcanzados por esa planta en los ultimos anos se deben a que los funcionarios directivos de ella realizaron de modo cientifico y rentable toda la administracion empresarial, incluyendo la produccion, el desarrollo tecnico y el servicio de abastecimiento, conforme al principio de administracion economica socialista al estilo coreano.
					
					Es muy importante que los funcionarios organizaran cientifica y minuciosamente la operacion economica y las actividades administrativas para acelerar la marcha de gran auge, resalto.
					
					 Tras presentar las tareas programaticas que incumben a la fabrica, expreso su gran esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y obreros de ella cumpliran perfectamente en el futuro tambien el papel de vanguardia y brigada en la materializacion de la politica economica del partido. -0-

articles.title: MINREX propone dialogo para firmar convenio de paz
articles.content:
MINREX propone dialogo para firmar convenio de paz
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ATCC) -- El Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publico el dia 11 la siguiente declaracion:
					Paso otro ano mientras el proceso de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana cayo en un dilema debido a los graves desafios.
					
					 La desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana es la meta politica que viene manteniendo invariablemente el gobierno de la RPDC para contribuir a la paz y la seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico y a la desnuclearizacion del mundo.
					
					 Gracias a los esfuerzos sinceros y constantes del gobierno de la RPDC, tuvieron lugar desde la decada de 1990 los dialogos para la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, en el curso de los cuales se aprobaron importantes acuerdos bilaterales y multilaterales como el "Acuerdo Basico RPDC-EE.UU." y la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre.
					
					 Sin embargo, quedo a medio hacer la implementacion de todos esos acuerdos si no fueron invalidados por completo. Entre tanto, crecio la amenaza nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana lejos de disminuir y, por consiguiente, aparecieron hasta las fuerzas nucleares disuasorias.
					
					 El proceso de las conversaciones a 6 bandas, que han sido frustradas y fracasadas repetidamente, demuestra que no se podra resolver jamas el problema mientras no exista la confianza entre las partes interesadas. Hasta en la actualidad, las conversaciones a 6 bandas no se reanudan debido a la barrera de desconfianza llamada la sancion anti-RPDC.
					
					Entonces, llegamos a la conclusion de que para volver a poner en su orbita el proceso de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, hay que prestar primordial atencion a la creacion de la confianza entre la RPDC y EE.UU., responsables principales del problema nuclear.
					
					 Para crear la confianza entre la RPDC y EE.UU., se deberia firmar primero el convenio de paz para poner punto final al estado de guerra, factor de las relaciones hostiles.
					
					En el estado beligerante en que las partes interesadas se enfrentan apuntando a la contraparte con el fusil, no sera desvanecida nunca la desconfianza en su contraparte ni marcharan sin complicaciones las conversaciones, lejos de la desnuclearizacion. Cualquier acuerdo, que no este vinculado al problema esencial y causal: la guerra y la paz, sufrira como hasta ahora la frustracion y el fracaso.
					
					 Desde el principio, el convenio de paz debio ser firmado ya partiendo de su propia necesidad independientemente del problema nuclear. Si ya se hubiera establecido un sistema de paz duradera en la Peninsula Coreana, no habria surgido el problema nuclear.
					
					 Dado que en la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre esta referido el problema sobre la concertacion del convenio de paz, no habria ningun inconveniente en adelantar el turno de acciones conforme a la demanda practica y a la luz de la leccion sacada del fracaso que vinieron sufriendo hasta ahora las conversaciones a 6 bandas.
					
					 La firma del convenio de paz eliminara las relaciones hostiles RPDC-EE.UU. e impulsara activamente a buen ritmo la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 Bajo la autorizacion, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC propone cortesmente a los paises responsables del Acuerdo de Armisticio iniciar inmediatamente el dialogo para sustituir este documento por el otro de paz en este ano del aniversario 60 del estallido de la guerra coreana.
					
					 El dialogo para la firma del convenio de paz podria abrirse por separado como lo establecido en la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre o en el marco de las conversaciones a 6 bandas para la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, al igual que el dialogo RPDC-EE.UU. actualmente en marcha, en vista de su caracter e importancia.
					
					 Seria posible que se reanuden pronto las mismas conversaciones a 6 bandas si se elimina la barrera de discriminacion y desconfianza llamada la sancion.
					
					 Si los paises responsables del Acuerdo de Armisticio desean de veras la paz, la seguridad y la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, deberan tomar la valiente decision de tratar el problema causal sin demorar mas el tiempo anteponiendo sus propios intereses.

articles.title: Obreros del Complejo Kim Chaek cartean a trabajadores del pais
articles.content:
Obreros del Complejo Kim Chaek cartean a trabajadores del pais
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ATCC) -- Los empleados del Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek enviaron el dia 9 a los trabajadores de todo el pais una carta llamando a dar fogonazos de la victoria en el frente de industria ligera y de agricultura al redoblar los esfuerzos y saltar llenos de conviccion y optimismo.
					Esta clara la meta de nuestra gran marcha y tenemos seguras posibilidades de triunfar en el ano 2010, comienza la misiva y prosigue:
					
					Debemos registrar sin falta un auge sin precedente y eventos maravillosos en la mejora de la vida del pueblo para llevar a la realidad el noble deseo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il de asegurar cuanto antes al pueblo una vida acomodada y para mostrar a todo el mundo que no se trata de palabras vanas la decision del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					 Hacer vivir al pueblo coreano gozando de la felicidad a sus anchas en un paraiso socialista donde no tenga nada que envidiar en este mundo, esto fue el deseo de toda la vida del Presidente Kim Il Sung y es el ardiente anhelo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Aunque nuestra tarea es enorme, tenemos el remedio omnipotente que nos conducira de nuevo a la victoria.
					
					Nos llegara sin falta la felicidad si seguimos confiando unicamente en el Dirigente quien conduce al frente la historica marcha general de hoy.
					
					 Al igual que el 2009 fue ano maravilloso de grandes eventos en que se hacian realidad los ideales del pueblo de acuerdo con la voluntad del Dirigente, 2010 sera tambien un ano en que se producira cambio decisivo en la vida del pueblo y repercutiran altas vivas al socialismo segun la decision de el.

articles.title: Seleccionados 10 mejores jugadores y entrenadores de Corea para 2009
articles.content:
Seleccionados 10 mejores jugadores y entrenadores de Corea para 2009
Pyongyang, 11 de enero (ATCC) -- En Corea fueron nominados 10 mejores jugadores y entrenadores para el 98 (2009) de la Era Juche.
					Entre los jugadores elites figuran el luchador Yang Kyong Il, el judoka Kim Chol Su, la luchadora Han Kum Ok, la luchadora So Sim Hyang, la judoka Rim Yun Hui, la gimnasta Hong Un Jong, la pesista O Jong Ae, el futbolista Ri Myong Guk, el luchador Jo Tong Hyok y la pesista Pak Hyon Suk en ese orden.
					
					En la categoria de directores tecnicos fueron nombrados Ri Chang Jong (de lucha), Ri Kwang (judo), Kang Chan Yong (lucha), Pak Jong Jin (lucha), Ri Song Chol (judo), Kim Chun Phil (gimnasia), So Un Hak (levantamiento de pesas), Kim Jong Hun (futbol), Pak Hye Jong (levantamiento de pesas) y Pak Ki Song (levantamiento de pesas).
